title: Distinct Inductions of and Responses to Type I and Type III Interferons Promote Infections in Two SARS-CoV-2 Isolates
affiliations: Department and Graduate Institute of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology, and 2

abstract:
The recent emerging coronavirus, SARS-CoV-2, has been rapidly and widely spread and causing an ongoing viral pneumonia outbreak worldwide. It has been observed that SARS-
CoV-2 patients show a rather long and asymptomatic incubation time. We characterized the abilities to induce and to response to IFNβ/IFNλ1 of two or our clinical isolates, SARS-CoV-

funding.funding-statement: This research was supported by MOST (Ministry of Science and Technology, R.O.C, https://www.most.gov.tw/?l=en) grant MOST 108-2320-B-002-026-MY3, MOST 108-2320-B-002-049 and MOST107-2320-B-002-016MY3. Author contributions
